programme.desc: Capping the mother of all comebacks, Kim Clijsters wins the 2009 US Open women's singles title by defeating Caroline Wozniacki after the the birth of her daughter.

programme.title: US Open 2013: Nadal v Djokovic
programme.desc: Revisit the 2013 US Open final as Rafael Nadal overpowered Novak Djokovic to win a second Flushing Meadows title.

programme.title: US Open 2019: Nadal v Medvedev
programme.desc: Rafael Nadal won his 19th Grand Slam and fourth US Open title with victory over Daniil Medvedev in 2019 at Flushing Meadows.

programme.title: Serena v Hingis 1999
programme.desc: Twenty-two years before Emma Raducanu's triumph over Leylah Fernandez, Serena Williams and Martina Hingis locked horns in an all-teenage final at the 1999 US Open in the women's singles.

programme.title: Murray v Nadal 2008
programme.desc: At the 2008 US Open, Sir Andy Murray came up against the number one seed Rafael Nadal in the men's singles semi-final at Louis Armstrong Stadium. Roger Federer would await in the final.

programme.title: Djokovic v Federer 2015
programme.desc: In the final of the 2015 US Open, Novak Djokovic battled past Roger Federer to secure his second title at Flushing Meadows, and a 10th Grand Slam overall for the Serb.

programme.title: Alcaraz v Ruud 2022
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz and Casper Ruud went toe to toe in the final of the men's singles at the 2022 US Open. With the Arthur Ashe stage set, both players were going for a first career Grand Slam.

programme.title: ATP Tour This Week

programme.desc: A look back on the career of the 22-time Grand Slam champion and undisputed King of Clay, Rafa Nadal, with stories shared by Tim Henman, Martina Navratilova, Andy Murray and more.

programme.title: Rome 2005: Nadal v Coria
programme.desc: In the 2005 Rome final, Rafael Nadal and Guillermo Coria went back and forth for over five hours in a breathtaking display of raw physicality and determination across five epic sets.

programme.desc: In a five-hour final at the Foro Italico in Rome, Rafael Nadal refused to succumb to Roger Federer as one of tennis' great rivalries came to a head.

programme.desc: The moment Rafael Nadal completed the career Grand Slam by winning his first US Open title in 2010 against Novak Djokovic in New York.

programme.desc: Politically Inept, with Homer Simpson: Homer gets his own political talk show after a video of his impassioned rant about how he was treated at the airport goes viral.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse of Sand and Fog: Milhouse is annoyed when his parents get back together. Homer catches chicken pox.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tenure Turbulence: Leonard, Sheldon, Raj and Kripke all compete for the same vacancy at the university.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Closure Alternative: Amy employs a series of exercises to cure Sheldon of his compulsion to complete every task without fail and seek closure for every incident.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Proton Resurgence: Leonard and Sheldon hire Professor Proton, the host of a TV science show they watched as children, to come to their flat and entertain them.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Little Big Mom: When Marge breaks her leg in a skiing accident, Lisa takes over running the Simpson household, and Homer and Bart end up moving to a leper colony in Hawaii.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - I, Carumbus: New episodes come to E4. The Simpsons go to Ancient Rome. Homer's a gladiator, and Bart becomes madder than Caligula.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: New Kids on the Block: Haley is determined to follow the advice in her parenting books with the twins, but Phil and Claire think their old methods are better.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Spy Who Learned Me: While he's on sick leave, Homer learns how to be a better husband, with the help of dashing spy movie crime fighter Stradivarius Cain (Bryan Cranston).

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Ned 'n' Edna's Blend: Marge offers to host Ned and Edna's secret wedding.

programme.title: Gogglebox: Celebrity Special...
programme.desc: ...for SU2C: Tom Daley, Charlotte Church and Gordon Ramsay join regular Goggleboxers for a special edition including The Watcher, I Can See Your Voice and Love Is Blind.

programme.title: Gemini Man
programme.desc: (2019) Will Smith stars in Ang Lee's action-thriller as both an over-the-hill hitman and the young clone of himself sent to take him out. With Clive Owen.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Kelly from Brighton needs some TLC but isn't sure if she wants a man or a woman. Carlo from Somerset is looking for the perfect woman after surviving leukaemia.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: YouTuber Jay has no problem sliding into girls' DMs but can't make connections in real life. Victoria has a thing for younger women and is after her very own Warrior Princess.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britain's sharpest armchair critics watch Wild Isles, Rise and Fall, Challenge Anneka, Race Across the World and The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up To Cancer.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: 'Alpha male' Josh is looking for his very own Kardashian. Is glam 25-year-old Yasmin his match? And will waxing entrepreneur Sherie's Marilyn Monroe dress be a hit with Richard?

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Bank Job: Peralta and Diaz learn there's more to Lt Melanie Hawkins' team than meets the eye as they continue their search for the gang of bank robbers.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Crime & Punishment: When Peralta and Diaz are framed for a crime they didn't commit, it's up to the other members of the Nine-Nine to save them from jail.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bonfire of the Manatees: Marge meets a handsome marine biologist (guest star Alec Baldwin). Will he woo her? Can Homer win her back?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Girl Who Slept Too Little: Lisa becomes plagued by nightmares when the council move the cemetery next door to the Simpsons' house.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse of Sand and Fog: Milhouse is annoyed when his parents get back together. Homer catches chicken pox.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Truth Be Told: After reconnecting on Facebook, Phil invites his old high school girlfriend to drop by the house, but this friendly visit quickly turns into trouble.

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: Build That Tune: The teams must build song titles that clearly represent the songs they're based on. Can a guest name those tunes?

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
programme.desc: (2003) Family comedy with Mike Myers. A badly behaved boy and his super-organised sister are plunged into an anarchic adventure when a man-sized talking cat suddenly appears at their home.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine: Gordon is in Pennsylvania to help rescue a soul food restaurant that was opened 12 years ago by a retired special education teacher.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Barefoot Bob's: Gordon visits Barefoot Bob's beachside restaurant in Massachusetts, where husband and wife Marc and Lisa struggle to attract customers during the winter months.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Revisit: Gordon revisits Caf Hon in Baltimore, Chiarella's in Philadelphia, and Leone's in New Jersey, to find out whether the owners have taken his advice on board.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Olde Hitching Post: Gordon visits the historic Olde Hitching Post restaurant in Massachusetts. Tom bought the business for his daughter but refuses to let her run it.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Fifteen Percent: Mitchell seeks revenge when Jay introduces Cameron as just his 'friend'. Gloria gives Manny's date a makeover.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Moon Landing: Claire feels slightly inadequate when her old friend, Valerie (guest star Minnie Driver), visits and is nothing like Claire remembered.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: My Funky Valentine: Phil and Claire break from their traditional Valentine's Day dinner date and plan a little role play excursion. And Jay and Gloria's ideas of romance clash.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Fears: When Phil and Luke embark on a discovery expedition underneath the house, Phil tries not to let his fear of the dark and of creepy crawlies get the best of him.

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: (1990) Action comedy with Arnold Schwarzenegger. A tough cop goes undercover as a kindergarten teacher. Tough? Ha! The kids'll take him down in no time.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Classified Materials Turbulence: Things look up for Leonard when Penny makes a surprising revelation on her second date with Stuart. Howard sees a flaw in his NASA project.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Monopolar Expedition: Leonard and Penny reconsider their feelings for each other, but then Leonard is offered the opportunity to spend the summer working at the North Pole.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Electric Can Opener Fluctuation: Leonard's attempts to woo Penny are constantly thwarted. Sheldon heads to Texas after learning his friends meddled with his expedition data.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Jiminy Conjecture: Leonard and Penny feel awkward around each other after their romantic liaison, while Sheldon and Howard take bets to determine a species of cricket.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gothowitz Deviation: Sheldon tries to modify Penny's behaviour, and rewards her with chocolate when she does what he wants, while Howard and Raj go to a goth nightclub.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Pirate Solution: Raj must find a job or he'll be sent back to India, so he accepts an offer of work from Sheldon. Leonard and Penny try to get some time for themselves.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Creepy Candy Coating Corollary: Due to a childhood snub, Sheldon is irked when Star Trek actor Wil Wheaton (guest starring as himself) takes part in the same contest as him.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the 'Box this time, Is It Cake, Too?, Hijack, Steph's Packed Lunch and Dr. Pimple Popper. As seen by Mo Gilligan, Jon Richardson, Gyles Brandreth, Melanie C and NDubz.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britain's sharpest armchair critics watch: Banged Up: Stars Behind Bars, Planet Earth, Bake Off, Culprits, The Curse of Robert the Doll and much more.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers have been watching The Crown, Survivor, 007: Road to a Million, The Good Ship Murder, Shoplifters: Caught Red Handed, and ITV News (cabinet reshuffle).

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: 'Alpha male' Josh is looking for his very own Kardashian. Is glam 25-year-old Yasmin his match? And will waxing entrepreneur Sherie's Marilyn Monroe dress be a hit with Richard?

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Can a self-confessed party animal who's looking for someone wild, a disco dancer, an ex-Playboy bunny and a biker daredevil find love in the First Dates restaurant?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Mama Maria: Gordon Ramsay visits Mama Maria's, a failing restaurant in Brooklyn, New York, where owner John is overwhelmed by running a business that's become stuck in the past.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine: Gordon is in Pennsylvania to help rescue a soul food restaurant that was opened 12 years ago by a retired special education teacher.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: In emotional scenes, Frankie and JJ each take to the stand in JJ's trial, before the jury return their verdict. Elsewhere, the truth about Rex is revealed, and there's a new couple in town.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Sam has 13k to spend on his perfect pixie wedding to his love, Luanne. Will sensible Luanne, who dreams of a traditional service, appreciate his outlandish scheme?

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Elle has her heart set on a classy wedding at Liverpool's iconic Liver Building. But Phil plans a big day to go down in history. Will his scheme turn out to be a wreck?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Levanti's: Gordon visits Pennsylvania, where he meets siblings whose inability to work together is risking their father's life savings at his Italian restaurant, Levanti's.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room: In California, Gordon visits Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room, where he tries to mend relationships between the owner, his wife and their children.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Nino's: Gordon visits Long Beach in California to save Nino's, a failing Italian restaurant that opened in 1958 and is now under the misguided leadership of eldest son, Nino.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Mill Street Bistro Part 1: Gordon's in Ohio, for the Mill Street Bistro, where the owner claims that he has the best menu between New York and LA but the diners disagree.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cornhusker Vortex: Sheldon teaches Leonard about American football so that he can try to fit in with Penny's friends. And Raj and Sheldon have a kite-fighting contest.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Guitarist Amplification: Sheldon is annoyed when Leonard and Penny argue about Penny's male friend staying over and he has to act as peacemaker.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Adhesive Duck Deficiency: Leonard, Raj and Howard go on a camping trip that alters their minds. Penny dislocates her shoulder when she slips in the shower.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Vengeance Formulation: Howard is scared about committing to Bernadette, so he avoids her. Then he realises that he's made a mistake and, to compensate, he proposes to her.

programme.title: Dante's Peak
programme.desc: (1997) Action thriller starring Pierce Brosnan and Linda Hamilton. The inhabitants of a volcano-side resort unwisely ignore a scientist's warning about its imminent eruption.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Hello Gutter, Hello Fadder: Homer bowls a perfect 300 and becomes a celebrity, even appearing on the Springfield Squares with Bumblebee Man and his old nemesis Ron Howard.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Eight Misbehavin': Apu and Manjula take fertility drugs to get pregnant and end up with octuplets. Local companies shower them with gifts, until the Shelbyville Nine are born.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Take My Wife, Sleaze: Homer wins a motorbike and forms the Hell's Satans biker gang with Lenny, Carl, Moe and Flanders. But then they run into the original Hell's Satans...

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Grift of the Magi: After Bart breaks his coccyx and ends up using a wheelchair, Principal Skinner foolishly hires Fat Tony to build ramps at the school.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Little Big Mom: When Marge breaks her leg in a skiing accident, Lisa takes over running the Simpson household, and Homer and Bart end up moving to a leper colony in Hawaii.

programme.title: New: The Simpsons

programme.title: New: The Simpsons

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: (2013) Sci-fi action-mystery set on a war-ravaged planet Earth that's been largely abandoned by humanity. With Tom Cruise, Andrea Riseborough, Olga Kurylenko and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: London Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2016) All-out action as Gerard Butler returns as US Secret Service agent Mike Banning in the second instalment of the Has Fallen franchise. Mike and POTUS get in a pickle in London.

programme.title: Brother
programme.desc: (2000) Takeshi 'Beat' Kitano directs and stars as a Japanese gangster exiled to Los Angeles, where he builds a drugs empire that attracts Mafia interest.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: (1954) Western with Robert Mitchum and Marilyn Monroe. An ex-con and a saloon singer steer a raft through hostile territory to face a showdown with her crooked fianc. With Rory Calhoun.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Gunfight at the OK Corral
programme.desc: (1957) Western. John Sturges's telling of the infamous battle in Tombstone stars Burt Lancaster as Wyatt Earp and Kirk Douglas as Doc Holliday. Also starring Dennis Hopper.

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third...
programme.desc: ...Kind: (1977) The director's cut of Steven Spielberg's sci-fi classic with Richard Dreyfuss. Everyman Roy Neary witnesses UFO activity and becomes obsessed with finding out the truth.

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: (1994) Thriller with Harrison Ford. Can CIA agent Jack Ryan rescue US troops abandoned in Colombia, with only a renegade agent to help? Wouldn't bet against him. With Willem Dafoe.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Taken
programme.desc: (2008) Action thriller. Liam Neeson stars as a former CIA operative who vows to track down his daughter after she's kidnapped in Paris.

programme.title: Sexy Beast
programme.desc: (2000) Jonathan Glazer's thriller with Ray Winstone, Ben Kingsley and Ian McShane. A criminal's blissful retirment is shattered by a psychopathic gangster who insists on one more job.

programme.title: Down Terrace
programme.desc: (2009) Comedy-drama. Father and son drug dealers (Robert and Robin Hill) think an informant threatens them, and are ready to kill to stop them.

programme.title: Thief
programme.desc: (1971) Crime thriller starring Richard Crenna. A recently paroled thief must do one last job to pay off old debts. But can he get away with it and build a life with his new girlfriend?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Tad the Lost Explorer and the...
programme.desc: ...Secret of King Midas: (2017) Animated adventure. Bumbling explorer Tad Jones returns to rescue the girl he fancies, using a notebook of clues to help find King Midas's necklace.

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: (1995) Swashbuckling adventure. Geena Davis and Matthew Modine star as pirates racing to find the missing parts of their treasure map and beat an evil rival (Frank Langella) to the booty.

programme.title: Babe
programme.desc: (1995) Charming family comedy-drama about a clever little pig who forms a close bond with a farmer and discovers a talent for herding sheep. With James Cromwell.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: (1989) Comedy-thriller starring Tom Hanks. A cop investigates a murder to which there's just one witness: Hooch, a slobbering, beer-drinking French mastiff, who now needs 24/7 protection.

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends: One and All
programme.desc: (2022) Sea-shanty-singing comedy sequel with James Purefoy. The band are on tour but it's not all plain sailing. The label want Jim to replace his dead dad and Leadville just ain't woke.

programme.title: A Few Good Men
programme.desc: (1992) High-stakes courtroom drama with more than a few good actors, including Jack Nicholson, Demi Moore and Tom Cruise. Can a lackadaisical naval lawyer crack a battle-hardened colonel?

programme.title: Chopper
programme.desc: (2000) Darkly comic, quasi-true crime biopic starring Eric Bana as notorious Australian criminal Mark 'Chopper' Read who, among other things, got a fellow inmate to chop off his ears.

programme.title: The Grudge
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural horror sequel. A tireless detective (Andrea Riseborough) investigates numerous murders that seem to be connected to one house. Strong language/gory violence.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Arthur's Hallowed Ground
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy drama. Jimmy Jewell stars as a cricket groundsman whose dream is to produce a pitch of billiard table perfection. But he finds himself at odds with the club committee.

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: (1997) Family fantasy comedy-adventure starring Jim Broadbent and Celia Imrie. A family of miniscule people live beneath the floorboards of a regular-sized family's house.

programme.title: Monsters v Aliens
programme.desc: (2009) Animated adventure comedy voiced by Reese Witherspoon, Seth Rogan, Hugh Laurie and Will Arnett. A group of misfit monsters battle an extraterrestrial threat.

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: (1969) Classic British crime caper with Michael Caine from a time when Minis were actually small. Can a gang of British robbers only blow the doors off and get the gold?

programme.title: Midway

programme.title: For the Love of Dogs with Alison Hammond
programme.desc: This Morning presenter Alison Hammond carries on the legacy left by the much-loved Paul O'Grady by heading to Battersea Dogs and Cats Home to help the animals in their care find new forever homes. In the opening episode, Alison bottle-feeds a three-day-old puppy found abandoned in a bin, meets a toy-obsessed terrier in training to be a sniffer dog, and falls head over heels for Nelly, a spaniel with a rare eye condition

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: The fast-paced game of words, hosted by Adil Ray, where three pairs of contestants face Lingo grids, fiendish puzzlewords, and a tense head-to-head round as they battle to reach the final and a chance to win a 15,000-pound jackpot. programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Ola Labib, Nadia Jae, Marcus Brigstocke and Richie Anderson join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Eddie Kadi to take viewers on a tour of Black British history.

programme.title: Lingo

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Join Stephen Mulhern as Eva steps up to play her game. programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern present the return of the ice-dancing contest as Anton Ferdinand, Charlie Brooks, Chelsee Healey, Chris Taylor, Dan Edgar, Ferne McCann, Josh Jones, Michaela Strachan, Mollie Pearce, Sam Aston and Steve Redgrave compete to become champion of the rink with the help of some of the world's leading skating professionals. Oti Mabuse and Ashley Banjo are on the judging panel with Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean, who will perform a new routine

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan chats to West End star Trevor Dion Nicholas and actress Jane Asher, David Domoney has tips with houseplants and artist Ruth Wheeler showcases the art of pyrography. Interiors expert Georgina Burnett takes on an upcycling project to inspire everyone to get crafting, resident farmer Charlie Dodd pops by with her latest additions and brewer Jaega Wise serves up pale ales and IPAs

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home by singer-songwriter David Gray, with chefs Lesley Waters, Daniel Galmiche and Corrin Harrison on hand to serve up some delicious recipes

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott delves into the tastes and flavours of North America, making his own version of a famous fast food chain's double burger, as well as peanut butter and jelly brownies. He is also joined by Ruby Bhogal, who tries to find out the secret behind the best fried chicken, and actress Sheree Murphy, who makes chicken pot pie

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef travels through Charente in south-west France, visiting a distillery in the Cognac region, meeting a miller who still uses traditional methods to make award-winning brioche loaves, and following in the Queen Mother's footsteps with a visit to Chateau de Venteuil, home of the De La Rochefoucauld family. Along the way he makes classic French onion soup and a salad incorporating some of the region's best produce, and pays homage to the patron saint of pastry chefs with a stunning dessert

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Ascot
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Clarence House Chase at Ascot. Plus, racing from Haydock Park. With analysis by Mick Fitzgerald and Tom Scudamore, reporting from Alice Plunkett, Sally Ann Grassick and Matt Chapman, and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed game show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Melvin Odoom, Carl Fogarty, Louis Smith and Bonnie Langford pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the game show, which sees novelty shop owner Jess, learning and development trainer Xhemal and former GP Pip spin the wheel and try to solve the word puzzles in a bid to win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of 50,000

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Diving star Tom Daley joins Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Maya Jama and Mo Gilligan on the panel for a special superhero edition of the oddball singing show. As usual, Joel Dommett invites five more secret celebrity singers to take the stage, before another one reveals his or her identity at the end of the show

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: There's more life-changing money on offer as Ant and Dec introduce NHS matrons Karis and Tim to the Limitless Ladder. They'd like to win a six-figure sum to buy a first home and help out their family and friends, but there's a huge surprise in store for them and a nerve-racking game to be played first. It's then husband and wife Arj and Charlotte's turn to climb the never-ending money ladder. Arj dreams of opening a restaurant one day, but can he make the dream a reality?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Max meets an anonymous informant who hands over a key piece of evidence - only to flee before he can get any further answers. Meg is furious Max has acted alone and let a potential witness disappear. Abigail and Simon make plans to return Sophie's body home - despite the British PM's orders for Abigail to finish negotiations on a trade deal between Australia and the UK

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Billy Connolly: My Absolute Pleasure
programme.desc: The comedian for an insight into the life he leads now. As the comedy great launches his first-ever autobiography, he shares a personal selection of his best-loved stand-up routines captured during his tours

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Cardiff City v Swansea City at Cardiff City Stadium, Sheffield United v Norwich City at Bramall Lane and Oxford United v Blackburn Rovers at Kassam Stadium in the Championship

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Max meets an anonymous informant who hands over a key piece of evidence - only to flee before he can get any further answers. programme.title: Inside M&S at New Year
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes at M&S Food as they develop a new ranged of products designed to improve health and wellbeing, from brain health-supporting snacks and protein-packed ready meals to gut friendly mushroom drinks

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Diving star Tom Daley joins Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Maya Jama and Mo Gilligan on the panel for a special superhero edition of the oddball singing show. As usual, Joel Dommett invites five more secret celebrity singers to take the stage, before another one reveals his or her identity at the end of the show

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads towards Louisiana's swamplands, where he ditches his car for a high-speed boat. He travels to the nearby city of Lafayette, where he visits the family run smokehouse Johnson's Boucaniere, and samples some of their traditional home-made sausage. James also tries ice cream from the famous Borden's ice cream parlour, before heading back to the swamps to cook one final dish

programme.title: The Royal Beat
programme.desc: Kate Thornton discusses all of the latest news surrounding the royal family with ITV News' Chris Ship, the Mirror's Russell Myers, and royal contributor for The Washington Post, Sarah Hewson

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are The Repair Shop favourite Will Kirk and award-winning actress and star of Rivals, Claire Rushbrook. Bolu Eso marks Burns Night with his pick of the finest Scottish dog breeds, DIY supremo Wayne Perrey gets us all saving water with his guide to installing water butts, we pay a visit to Brixton to discover how horse riding is inspiring young people in the heart of the city, and Andy Clarke serves up some cosy cocktails

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Leeds United v Sheffield Wednesday (Kick-off 12.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents coverage of the Championship match between the Yorkshire rivals at Elland Road. Leeds claimed a 2-0 win in August's reverse fixture at Hillsborough thanks to goals by Brenden Aaronson and Daniel James, and will be looking to further boost their hopes of earning automatic promotion with another three points. However, Wednesday will have promotion aspirations of their own, as a good run of results would put them very much in play-off contention

programme.title: The Croods
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure with the voices of Emma Stone, Ryan Reynolds and Nicolas Cage. A prehistoric family are made homeless by an earthquake and are forced to trek through hostile territory in search of a new cave, encountering weird and wonderful wildlife en route.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the game show, which sees novelty shop owner Jess, learning and development trainer Xhemal and former GP Pip spin the wheel and try to solve the word puzzles in a bid to win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of 50,000

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ortis Deley, Maggie Aderin-Pocock, Graeme Hall and Sarah Millican pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern are back with the second live show in which five more celebrities and their partners take to the ice in the hope of avoiding the first elimination of the series. Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean head up the judging panel alongside dance supremos Ashley Banjo and Oti Mabuse, and the skating professionals perform two routines

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Married couple Arj and Charlotte are back to continue their game. Arj wants to open a restaurant and Charlotte wants to get a giant rabbit, but can Ant and Dec help make their dreams come true as they make their way up the money ladder? It's then the turn of best friends from Northern Ireland Phil and Arainn. They've got their eyes on half a million pounds and a trip to The Masters with their friends as they play, but can they cash out in time?

programme.title: Out There
programme.desc: A man finds himself fighting back against the dark urban menace making their way into his community. Nathan is forced to do a deal with the devil to protect his family, his land and his livelihood. Drama set in a rural community, starring Martin Clunes and Mark Lewis Jones

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: The Sheridans are startled to find Alex in their kitchen making an impressive breakfast, but they're even more confused about how Shiv has managed to bag herself such an impressive boyfriend. Tom tries to fly under the radar as he continues to hide the fact that he's lost his job and Caroline questions whether Shane really is the man for her

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: Shiv books an acupuncture session with Mina, but she has an agenda. Caroline reels from her news and run-ins with Finbar and Dr Dan only rattle her further. Mina tells Tom he needs to stop living in the shed and stand up to Bernie

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follows the stories of two women looking for siblings given up for adoption, but for very different reasons. Jeanette Woodyatt wants to find the brother she has never met and who was turned away from the family by her grandmother, while Karen Turnbull yearns to let her twin siblings know that their mother gave them up for adoption so they would have a better life

programme.title: Britain's Notorious Prisons: Wormwood Scrubs
programme.desc: Using first-hand testimony from past inmates and staff, the second documentary in this series tells the truth about life behind the walls of Wormwood Scrubs, one of Britain's most notorious jails. It includes the story of spy George Blake's 1966 escape from the Scrubs, which had a long-lasting impact on the prison system as a whole

programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home by singer-songwriter David Gray, with chefs Lesley Waters, Daniel Galmiche and Corrin Harrison on hand to serve up some delicious recipes

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott delves into the tastes and flavours of North America, making his own version of a famous fast food chain's double burger, as well as peanut butter and jelly brownies. He is also joined by Ruby Bhogal, who tries to find out the secret behind the best fried chicken, and actress Sheree Murphy, who makes chicken pot pie

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef travels through Charente in south-west France, visiting a distillery in the Cognac region, meeting a miller who still uses traditional methods to make award-winning brioche loaves, and following in the Queen Mother's footsteps with a visit to Chateau de Venteuil, home of the De La Rochefoucauld family. Along the way he makes classic French onion soup and a salad incorporating some of the region's best produce, and pays homage to the patron saint of pastry chefs with a stunning dessert

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: There's more life-changing money on offer as Ant and Dec introduce NHS matrons Karis and Tim to the Limitless Ladder. They'd like to win a six-figure sum to buy a first home and help out their family and friends, but there's a huge surprise in store for them and a nerve-racking game to be played first. It's then husband and wife Arj and Charlotte's turn to climb the never-ending money ladder. Arj dreams of opening a restaurant one day, but can he make the dream a reality?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Max meets an anonymous informant who hands over a key piece of evidence - only to flee before he can get any further answers. programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are The Repair Shop favourite Will Kirk and award-winning actress and star of Rivals, Claire Rushbrook. Bolu Eso marks Burns Night with his pick of the finest Scottish dog breeds, DIY supremo Wayne Perrey gets us all saving water with his guide to installing water butts, we pay a visit to Brixton to discover how horse riding is inspiring young people in the heart of the city, and Andy Clarke serves up some cosy cocktails

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Leeds United v Sheffield Wednesday (Kick-off 12.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents coverage of the Championship match between the Yorkshire rivals at Elland Road. Leeds claimed a 2-0 win in August's reverse fixture at Hillsborough thanks to goals by Brenden Aaronson and Daniel James, and will be looking to further boost their hopes of earning automatic promotion with another three points. However, Wednesday will have promotion aspirations of their own, as a good run of results would put them very much in play-off contention

programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure with the voices of Emma Stone, Ryan Reynolds and Nicolas Cage. A prehistoric family are made homeless by an earthquake and are forced to trek through hostile territory in search of a new cave, encountering weird and wonderful wildlife en route.

He is also joined by Ruby Bhogal, who tries to find out the secret behind the best fried chicken, and actress Sheree Murphy, who makes chicken pot pie

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef travels through Charente in south-west France, visiting a distillery in the Cognac region, meeting a miller who still uses traditional methods to make award-winning brioche loaves, and following in the Queen Mother's footsteps with a visit to Chateau de Venteuil, home of the De La Rochefoucauld family. Along the way he makes classic French onion soup and a salad incorporating some of the region's best produce, and pays homage to the patron saint of pastry chefs with a stunning dessert

It's then husband and wife Arj and Charlotte's turn to climb the never-ending money ladder. Arj dreams of opening a restaurant one day, but can he make the dream a reality?
